member.summary: Unable to create connection complete event object.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_CONNECTION_UNABLE_START_COMMUNICATION
member.summary: Unable to create communication thread.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_CONNECTION_TERMINATED

member.summary: The connection has been terminated by user.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_CONNECTION_CLOSED
member.summary: The connection has been closed.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_CONNECTION_UNEXPECTED
member.summary: Unexpected error.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_CONNECTION_UNABLE_CREATE_OR_INIT_CLIENT
member.summary: A server was not able to create or init client connection instance.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_CONNECTION_UNABLE_FIND_CLIENT_CLASS
member.summary: A server was not able to find a specific client connection class.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_BASE
member.summary: The base error code for OBEX errors.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NOT_CONNECTED
member.summary: An OBEX client is not connected to an OBEX server.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_CONNECTED
member.summary: An OBEX client is already connected to an OBEX server.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_OPERATION_IN_PROGRESS
member.summary: An OBEX operation is in progress.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_CONTINUE
member.summary: The server has received the request headers and the client should proceed to send the request body (in the case of a request for which a body needs to be sent).
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_CREATED
member.summary: The request has been fulfilled, resulting in the creation of a new resource.
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_ACCEPTED
member.summary: The request has been accepted for processing, but the processing has not been completed. The request might or might not be eventually acted upon, and may be disallowed when processing occurs.
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NON_AUTHORITATIVE
member.summary: The server is a transforming proxy that received a WCL_E_SUCCESS from its origin, but is returning a modified version of the origin's response.
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NO_CONTENT
member.summary: The server successfully processed the request and is not returning any content.
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_RESET_CONTENT
member.summary: The server successfully processed the request, but is not returning any content. Unlike a WCL_E_OBEX_NO_CONTENT error, this error requires that the requester reset the object.
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_PARTIAL_CONTENT
member.summary: The server is delivering only part of the resource due to a range header sent by the client. The range header is used by OBEX clients to enable resuming of interrupted downloads, or split a download into multiple simultaneous streams.
member.remarks: This result code is not an error and indicates the action requested by the client was received, understood and accepted.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_MULTIPLE_CHOICES
member.summary: Indicates multiple options for the resource from which the client may choose.
member.remarks: This status code is not an error but indicates the client must take additional action to complete the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_MOVED_PERMANENTLY
member.summary: This and all future requests should be directed to the given URI.
member.remarks: This status code is not an error but indicates the client must take additional action to complete the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_MOVED_TEMPORARY
member.summary: The response to the request can be found under another URI using the GET method.
member.remarks: This status code is not an error but indicates the client must take additional action to complete the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_SEE_OTHER
member.summary: The response to the request can be found under another URI using the GET method.
member.remarks: This status code is not an error but indicates the client must take additional action to complete the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NOT_MODIFIED
member.summary: Indicates that the resource has not been modified since the version specified by the request headers If-Modified-Since or If-None-Match. In such case, there is no need to retransmit the resource since the client still has a previously-downloaded copy.
member.remarks: This status code is not an error but indicates the client must take additional action to complete the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_USE_PROXY
member.summary: The requested resource is available only through a proxy, the address for which is provided in the response.
member.remarks: This status code is not an error but indicates the client must take additional action to complete the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_BAD_REQUEST
member.summary: The server cannot or will not process the request due to an apparent client error (e.g., malformed request syntax, size too large, invalid request message framing, or deceptive request routing).

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_UNAUTHORIZED
member.summary: Similar to WCL_E_OBEX_FORBIDDEN, but specifically for use when authentication is required and has failed or has not yet been provided. The response must include a WWW-Authenticate header field containing a challenge applicable to the requested resource.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_PAYMENT_REQUIRED
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_FORBIDDEN
member.summary: The request was valid, but the server is refusing action. The user might not have the necessary permissions for a resource, or may need an account of some sort.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NOT_FOUND
member.summary: The requested resource could not be found but may be available in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_METHOD_NOT_ALLOWED
member.summary: A request method is not supported for the requested resource.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NOT_ACCEPTABLE
member.summary: The requested resource is capable of generating only content not acceptable according to the Accept headers sent in the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_PROXY_AUTH_REQUIRED
member.summary: The client must first authenticate itself with the proxy.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_REQUEST_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The server timed out waiting for the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_CONFLICT
member.summary: Indicates that the request could not be processed because of conflict in the request, such as an edit conflict between multiple simultaneous updates.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_GONE
member.summary: Indicates that the resource requested is no longer available and will not be available again.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_LENGTH_REQUIRED
member.summary: The request did not specify the length of its content, which is required by the requested resource.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_PRECONDITION_FAILED
member.summary: The server does not meet one of the preconditions that the requester put on the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_REQUEST_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: The request is larger than the server is willing or able to process.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_URL_TOO_LARGE
member.summary: The URI provided was too long for the server to process.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_UNSUPPORTED_MEDIA_TYPE
member.summary: The request entity has a media type which the server or resource does not support. For example, the client uploads an image as image/svg+xml, but the server requires that images use a different format.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_INTERNAL
member.summary: A generic error, given when an unexpected condition was encountered and no more specific message is suitable.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
member.summary: The server either does not recognize the request method, or it lacks the ability to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_BAD_GATEWAY
member.summary: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and received an invalid response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE
member.summary: The server is currently unavailable (because it is overloaded or down for maintenance). Generally, this is a temporary state. Also this error indicates that wrong Connect ID or Target used.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_GATEWAY_TIMEOUT
member.summary: The server was acting as a gateway or proxy and did not receive a timely response from the upstream server.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_HTTP_VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED
member.summary: The server does not support the HTTP protocol version used in the request.[

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_DATABASE_FULL
member.summary: Indicates that the client requests that something be placed into a database but the database is full (cannot take more data).

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_DATABASE_LOCKED
member.summary: Returned when the client wishes to access a database, database table, or database record that has been locked.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_OPERATION_TERMINATED_BY_DISCONNECT
member.summary: The current operation has been terminated because a remote device is disconnected.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_OPERATION_TERMINATED_BY_USER
member.summary: The current operation has been terminated by a user.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_INVALID_OPERATION_SEQUENCE
member.summary: The operation can not be executed at this time. This error appears if for example an application calls Terminate for Connect, Disconnect or SetPath operations.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_DISCONNECTED
member.summary: The error code indicates that the OBEX session has been disconnected by a remote side.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_UNEXPECTED
member.summary: Unexpected or unknown OBEX result code.

member.summary: Unable to create synchronization Mutex used to generate connection ID.

member.summary: The maximum connection ID has been reached.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclConnectionErrors.WCL_E_OBEX_INVALID_STATE
member.summary: Invalid data processor state.

member.summary: Unable to parse directory listing.

member.summary: Wrong directory listing format.

member.summary: COM initialization failed.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclClientConnection.HalCommunicate(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that communicate with the connected remote device.
member.param: The system even object handle (disconnect event).
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Derived classes must override this method to implement a hardware-dependent code that exchanges data with a remote device.
The method executes in a separate thread.
The method implementation must monitor the Event parameter. The Event parameter is set if the Disconnect method was called and the method must terminate communication and exit.
The default implementation simple waits for the Event and exists when the events signaled.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclClientConnection.HalConnect(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that connects to a remote device.
member.param: The system even object handle.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Derived classes must override this method to implement a hardware-dependent code that connects to a remote device.
The method executes in a separate thread.

The method implementation must monitor the Event parameter. The Event parameter is set if the Disconnect method was called. If the termination event was set the method must terminate connection operation.
If connection to a remote device was terminated the method must release all allocated resources because the HalDisconnect will not be called.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclClientConnection.HalDisconnect
member.summary: Implements a hardware-dependent code that disconnects from the connected remote device.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method is called only if a connection to a remote device was established with success (the Connect method was success).
The method will not be called if the connection to the remote device was terminated in the middle of the HalConnect method.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclClientConnection.#ctor

member.summary: Frees the connection.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclClientConnection.Connect(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Connects to a remote device.
member.param: The connect timeout in milliseconds. The default value is 10000 milliseconds.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method starts a connection operation to a remote device. If the method success that does not mean that the connection was established. That just means that the connection operation was started. The real connection result will be passed to the OnConnect event handler.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclClientConnection.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the connected remote device.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.
member.remarks: The method disconnects from the connected remote device or terminates the pending connection.

member.name: T:wclCommunication.wclCustomObexClient
member.summary: The base class for OBEX client data processors.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclCustomObexClient.Connect(System.Guid,System.Guid,System.String)
member.summary: Connects to an OBEX server.
member.param: Specifys the UUID of the desired application. If the Target is not used it must be set to NULL GUID.
Can also be used when it is necessary to identify the client initiating the exchange. If the Who is not used it must be set to NULL GUID.
Provides an information about the device or service. If the Description is not used it must be set to an empty string.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: Target and Who are used to hold a unique identifier, which allows applications to tell whether they are talking to a strict peer, or not. Typically, this is used to enable additional capabilities supplied only by an exact peer.

On full-featured [PC] platforms, multiple OBEX applications may exist concurrently. This leads to the need for the client to be able to uniquely identify which server it wants to handle its request. The server is therefore identified with the OBEX Target header. If necessary, the client can also identify itself, using the OBEX Who header. The following text describes the exact uses of these headers.

To target a specific application with OBEX commands the client must set-up a connection to the application by using the OBEX Target header in a CONNECT request. This type of connection is called a directed connection and provides a virtual binding between the client and server. The Target header should specify the UUID of the desired application. The Who header can also be used when it is necessary to identify the client initiating the exchange. The Who header should be used in cases where the target server application supports different client applications and may care which one it is connecting to. It is unnecessary to send a Who header in the request if its only logical value is the same as the Target header.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclCustomObexClient.Get(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Requests an object from a server.
member.param: The object's name. If the parameter is an empty string the Name is ignored.
The object's MIME type. If the parameter is an empty string the Mime is ignored.
The object's data stream. This must be valid empty stream object. The stream must have write access permition.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method starts receiving an object from an OBEX server. When sending is completed the OnGetComplete event fires with the operation result.
The Stream object passed to the method must be valid until OnGetComplete event fires. An application can destroy the stream object passed as the Stream parameter only after OnGetComplete event fired.
During execution of the Get operation the OnProgress event may (or may not) fire indicating the operation progress.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclCustomObexClient.Put(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Sends one object from the client to the server.
member.param: The object's name. If the parameter is an empty string the Name is ignored.
The object's MIME type. If the parameter is an empty string the Mime is ignored.
The object's description. If the parameter is an empty string the Description is ignored.

The object's data stream. If the parameter is null it forces to delete the object with the name specified by the Name parameter or with MIME type specified by the Mime parameter. If the Stream parameter is an empty stream (it is not null and the Stream size is 0) it forces a server to create an empty object with the given Name or MIME.
The application parameters raw bytes.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method starts sending an object (or other operation described above) to a OBEX server. When sending is completed the OnPutComplete event fires with the operation result.

If an application passes a valid Stream object to the method the object must be valid until OnPutComplete event fires. An application can destroy the stream object passed as the Stream parameter only after OnPutComplete event fired.
During execution of the Put operation the OnProgress event may (or may not) fire indicating the operation progress.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclCustomObexClient.SetPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Changes the current directory on the server's side.
member.param: The directory name. If the Dir value is ".." it tells to the server to backup a level (go one level up). If the Dir is an empty string it tells to the server to go to the default (root) directory).

If this parameter is set to True it tells server to create new directory with the given name. If this parameter is set to False and the directory specified in the Dir parameter does not exists the WCL_E_OBEX_BAD_REQUEST or the WCL_E_OBEX_FORBIDDEN error returned as the operation complete result.
member.remarks: The method sets the current directory on the receiving side in order to enable transfers that need additional path information. For instance, when a nested set of directories is sent between two machines, SetPath is used to create the directory structure on the receiving side.

member.name: M:wclCommunication.wclObexFileClient.Put(System.String,System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Sends one object from the client to the server.
member.param: The object's name. If the parameter is an empty string the Name is ignored.
The object's description. If the parameter is an empty string the Description is ignored.
The object's data stream.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: The method starts sending an object to an OBEX server. When sending is completed the OnPutComplete event fires with the operation result.

If an application passes a valid Stream object to the method the object must be valid until OnPutComplete event fires. An application can destroy the stream object passed as the Stream parameter only after OnPutComplete event fired.
During execution of the Put operation the OnProgress event may (or may not) fire indicating the operation progress.

member.name: E:wclCommunication.wclObexFileClient.OnGetComplete
member.summary: The event fires when the Get operation has been completed.
member.remarks: If the operation completed with success the Stream object contains the object's data. If the operation completed with error the Stream contains a partial data and is invalid. An application can not use the object from the Stream if the operation completed with error.

member.name: E:wclCommunication.wclObexFileClient.OnPutComplete
member.summary: The event fires when the Put operation has been completed.
member.remarks: An application can dispose the Stream object passed to the Put method. The state of the Stream object is changed.

member.param: The object's type.
The object's data stream.
member.returns: If the function succeed the return value is . Otherwise the method returns one of the WCL error codes.

remarks.para: This function can be used to pull (request) the default business card (vCard) from a target device. To do that the aType parameter must be "text/x-vCard" string.

An application must pass a valid Stream object to the method and the stream object must be valid until OnGetComplete event fires. An application can destroy the stream object passed as the Stream parameter only after OnGetComplete event fired.
During execution of the Get operation the OnProgress event may (or may not) fire indicating the operation progress.

member.name: T:wclCommunication.wclObexFilePermission
member.summary: The OBEX file object permission.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclObexFilePermission.opRead
member.summary: Read permission.
member.remarks: The READ permission applies to all object types. It indicates that an attempt to GET the named object should successfully retrieve its contents.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclObexFilePermission.opWrite
member.summary: Write permission.
member.remarks: The WRITE permission applies to all object types. It indicates that an attempt to modify the contents of the file by PUTing to the file should succeed. For folder objects it indicates that attempts to create a folder or other object within that folder should succeed.

member.name: F:wclCommunication.wclObexFilePermission.opDelete
member.summary: Delete permission.
member.remarks: The DELETE permission applies to file types. It indicates that the file may be removed by sending a DELETE command.

member.summary: The user level permissions.
member.remarks: A permission indicator does not imply that the appropriate command is guaranteed to work just that it might. Other system specific limitations, such as limitations on available space for storing objects, may cause an operation to fail, where the permission flags may have indicated that it was likely to succeed. The permissions are a guide only. Some systems may have more specific permissions than those listed here, such systems should map those to the flags defined as best they are able.

member.summary: The method called when a remote client opens OBEX session (connects).
member.param: The requested target service/server ID.
The client's ID.
The connect operation's or client's description.

remarks.para: A derived class must override this method to accept or reject connection. The default implementation rejects any connection requests.
To accept connection an implementation must call the Accept method. To reject the connection request an implementation myst call the Reject method.

In case the Target and/or Who values were not provided by a client the values of these parameters are GUID_NULL. If the Description was not provided by a client the value of this parameter is an empty string.

member.name: P:wclCommunication.wclCustomObexServer.ConnectionId
member.summary: Connection ID.

remarks.para: The Connection ID is assigned internally when a remote client opens OBEX session. An application may use this value to unique identify the connected client and/or session.
The Connect ID value is unique per application. If the Connection ID is zero the OBEX session has not been established yet.
